Package assignment4

Class Critter1

  • java.lang.Object
    • assignment4.Critter
      • assignment4.Critter1
  • public class Critter1
extends Critter
    This critter class is modeled after a "hive-mind" mentality, using static variables as a form of communication amongst all of the critters. In the interest of the species, and knowing that they can all only move once a turn and that that always move, if they encounter each other, if one is weak (<75% reproduction energy) it will submit to being eaten, so energy is preserved and the species will (hopefully) survive. If the population reproduces many times, it will change movement direction by 90 degrees counterclockwise so the babies aren't constantly being spawned in atop other members of the species runStats gives population count and the direction the population is moving.

    • Method Detail

      • doTimeStep

        public void doTimeStep()
        The function that determines what this critter does each world time step. This species of critter will walk in move_direction if doing so will not lead to its death. The critter will also reproduce if it has sufficient energy - the offspring will be placed in move_direction. When this critter reproduces, it increments the field reproductions, and when reproductions reaches more than half of either the width or height of the world, the species will turn 90 degrees (incrementing move_direction by 2)
        Specified by:
        doTimeStep in class Critter

      • fight

        public boolean fight​(java.lang.String oponent)
        Whether this critter will fight another critter when they share a space. If the other critter is of the same class (oponent.equals"1") this critter will only fight the other if its energy is at least 75% of the minimum reproduction energy (in Params.class)
        Specified by:
        fight in class Critter
        Parameters:
        oponent - The String representation of the other critter this critter may fight.
        Returns:
        Whether this critter will fight the other.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        How this critter appears in the world
        Overrides:
        toString in class Critter
        Returns:
        "1"

      • runStats

        public static void runStats​(java.util.List<Critter> population)
        This override of the runStats method indicates the current direction the species is using and the reproduction count since last direction change in addition to the population count.
        Parameters:
        population - The List of all Critter1 instances
